elements.name: SecurityTopPriority
elements.title: Should security be among the top priorities in IT spending for your organization?

elements.name: ITBugdetPercentageOnSecurity
elements.title: What percentage of IT budget do you believe should be allocated to security measures in your organization? (Select only one)

elements.name: SecurityInvestmentsTopPriority
elements.title: If you agree (Q1), what are the main reasons for considering security investments as top priority in your organization (Select all that apply)
choices: Protecting brand or name or company reputation

elements.name: AlignmentOfSecurityInvestments
elements.title: How important is the alignment of security investments with the overall business goals and objectives of your organization? (Select only one)

elements.name: ReviewingAndUpdatingFinance
elements.title: How important is it for your organization to have a well-defined process for reviewing and updating finance or budget for security investments when it is required /on demand?(Select only one)

elements.name: SecurityInvestmentsAndFinance
elements.title: How would rate the relationship between the need for security investments with the need to remain financially competitive in your organization?

elements.name: DrivingSecurityInvestmentsChallenges
elements.title: What challenges, if any, you believe does your organization face in driving security investments? (Select all that apply)
choices: Lack of awareness or understanding of security risks
Difficulty in prioritizing security investments against other competing priorities
Lack of executive support and commitment
Inadequate expertise and skills in managing security investments

elements.name: InvolvementOfOtherDepartments
elements.title: How do you perceive the level of involvement and engagement of other departments in security investment decisions?

elements.name: SecurityFeatures
elements.title: Are security features among the factors you have emphasized in marketing efforts?

elements.name: SpendingOnSecurityInvestments
elements.title: What factors do you think influence the organization’s decision on how much to spend on security investments? (Select all that apply)

elements.name: IncreaseOfInvestmentsForCybersecurity
elements.title: To what extend your organization be willing to increase its investments for new technology adoption because of cyber security? (Select only one)

elements.name: DecisionsOnSecurityInvestments
elements.title: Do you think your organization’s decisions on security investments are informed by changes in the security market?

elements.name: AdoptionOfNewTechnology
elements.title: What are the main reasons for considering the adoption of a new technology?(Select all that apply))

elements.name: PriotizeCostSavingsOverSecurity
elements.title: How likely is your organization to prioritize cost savings over security when considering the purchase of less secure, but less expensive technology products?

elements.name: BenefitsOfAdoptingSecureTechnology
elements.title: How often do you think your organization view the potential benefits of adopting a more secure technology?

elements.name: AdditionalBudgetInAdoptingSecureTechnology
elements.title: Would your organization be willing to adopt a more secure technology even if it may require addition budget allocation or upfront costs?

elements.name: ImplementationOfSecureTechnologyDrivers
elements.title: What key drivers for implementing a new secure technology in your organization? (Select all that apply)
choices: Complying with industry regulations and standards

elements.name: PastSecurityIncidentsInfluence
elements.title: To what extent past security incidents or breaches shaped the direction and priorities of your organization security strategy?

elements.name: BarriersInAdoptingSecureTechnology
elements.title: What are the key challenges or barriers that you organization would face in adopting a more secure technology? (Select all that apply)
choices: Lack of technical expertise or resources
Lack of clear return on investment

elements.name: FamiliarityWithDigitalSecurityByDesign
elements.title: How familiar is you with the concept of Digital Security by Design, which promotes secure-by-design principles in technology development? (Select only one)
choices: Heard of it, but do not have a clear understanding

elements.name: PrioritizingSecureByDesignTechnology
elements.title: Would your organization prioritize a secure by design technology and ready for further investment, if it would significantly mitigate security vulnerabilities?

elements.name: FactorsInAdoptingDigitalSecurityByDesign
elements.title: What are the key factors that your organization would need to consider when adopting a Digital Security by Design technology solution? (Select all that apply)
choices: Robustness and effectiveness of security measures
Compliance with industry standards and regulations
Scalability and flexibility to adapt current and future security threats

elements.name: IncentivesForSecureByDesignPrinciple
elements.title: Would you be willing to incentivize into development of products that are secure by design principle? (Select all that apply)
choices: Funding or grants for research and development
Collaboration opportunities with other  organizations or experts
Recognition or awards for secure design products

elements.name: IncentivesInTheAdoptionOfDSbD
elements.title: Do you think your organization would like to incentivize the adoption of a secure by design technology?

elements.name: ObstaclesMigratingToDSbD
elements.title: What factors do you see as obstacles that you may consider when it would require migrating from your current technology to a more secure by design technology? (Select all that apply)
choices: Time and effort required for migration
Disruption to current operations and processes
